alert.note: Alert for Stillwater (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 11:43AM MDT until June 14 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Billings MT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Montana... Stillwater River near Absarokee affecting Stillwater County. For the Stillwater River...including Absarokee... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stillwater River near Absarokee. * WHEN...From this morning to Tuesday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 7.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 AM MDT Sunday was 7.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage late this morning to 7.2 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then rise above flood stage late tonight to 7.7 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will fall below flood stage again tomorrow afternoon to 5.0 feet early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 7.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.2 feet on 06/15/1967. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Stillwater River Absarokee 7.5 7.7 Sun 11 am 7.7 6.6 5.6 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1145 AM MDT.
